text:
Gas (Pipeline Corridor) South Esk Order 2014

I make the following order under section 79E of the Gas Act 2000 .

14 October 2014

MATTHEW GROOM

Minister for Energy

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Gas (Pipeline Corridor) South Esk Order 2014 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Interpretation
    In this order –
        Act means the Gas Act 2000 .

4. Planning corridor
        (1) In this clause –
            pipeline means the pipeline that –
                    (a) is referred to in the licence granted under section 24 of the Act to Tas Gas Networks Pty Ltd on 14 July 2003, as amended; and
                    (b) extends from –
                            (i) the Carrick Offtake Facility to the northern bank of the South Esk River adjacent to Main Street, Hadspen; and
                            (ii) the northern bank of the South Esk River adjacent to Main Street Hadspen to the easternmost point of the property situated at 514 Meander Valley Road, Hadspen; and
                            (iii) the easternmost point of the property situated at 514 Meander Valley Road, Hadspen to the Westbury Road District Regulator Station; and
                    (c) is shown bounded by a heavy, black, broken line on Plan 9751 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 1 to this order.
        (2) A planning corridor is declared in respect of the pipeline.
        (3) The planning corridor declared in respect of the pipeline –
                (a) extends along the length of the pipeline and is –
                        (i) for so much of the pipeline as is referred to in paragraph (b)(i) and (iii) of the definition of pipeline in subclause (1) of this clause – 150 metres wide on each side of the pipeline; and
                        (ii) for so much of the pipeline as is referred to in paragraph (b)(ii) of the definition of pipeline in subclause (1) of this clause – 38 metres wide on each side of the pipeline; and
                (b) extends away from each end of the pipeline in a semicircle with a radius of 150 metres from the centre-line at that end of the pipeline.
        (4) For the purposes of subclause (3)(a) of this clause, the width of each side of the planning corridor in respect of the pipeline is measured –
                (a) from the centre-line of the pipeline; and
                (b) at a right angle from the centre-line of the pipeline.

SCHEDULE 1 - Plan

Clause 4

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 22 October 2014

This order is administered in the Department of State Growth.
